Package main.java.dev.unworthiness.sort

Class Main

java.lang.Object
main.java.dev.unworthiness.sort.Main
public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
Contains all logic for importing a list from a file, sorting the list, and then writing the list to another file.
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
mn

    • requestFilePath

      private static java.lang.String requestFilePath()
      Prompts the user for the path to their file then escapes all \ characters.
      Returns:
      filePath the path to the file with \ escaped.

    • retrieveFile

      private static java.io.File retrieveFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
      Retrieves a file from a specified file path.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file.
      Returns:
      file the File generated by the filePath.

    • importData

      private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> importData​(java.io.File namesFile) throws java.lang.Exception
      Reads a file and generates a list where each line is an element.
      Parameters:
      namesFile - the file to be read from.
      Returns:
      parsedData A list of strings where each line read is an element of the list.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if there is an error reading the provided file.

    • writeCollectionToFile

      private static <T> void writeCollectionToFile​(java.util.Collection<T> toWrite) throws java.lang.Exception
      Writes a collection to a file with each element of the collection being written on a new line.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type parameter.
      Parameters:
      toWrite - the collection to write to the file.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if there is an error writing the collection to a file.

    • sortListBySize

      private static void sortListBySize​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> toSort)
      Sorts a list of strings from smallest to largest length.
      Parameters:
      toSort - the list to sort.

    • sortListAlphabetically

      private static void sortListAlphabetically​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> toSort)
      Sorts a section of a list of strings alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      toSort - the list to sort.

    • sortListSizeAlphabetically

      private static void sortListSizeAlphabetically()
      Main logic for the program.

      Prompts the user for a file path, then attempts to read each line of the file into a list. If this is successful, the list is sorted by size and then alphabetically for each size. The list is then written to a text file as output.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Calls the method responsible for main logic.
      Parameters:
      args - Default.
